description:
At the heart of this collaboration lies a deep exploration: how the violin and
nagaswaram--melodic instruments from divergent lineages--converse, contrast,
and complement one another. Alongside, the rhythmic dialogue between mridangam
and thavil unfolds with equal intrigue and intensity.  
  
Crafted with careful attention to the sonic and musical identities of each
instrument, every performance is a journey--blending composition with
improvisation, structure with spontaneity. It is not merely a fusion, but a
celebration of what emerges when boundaries are set aside and traditions meet
in free-flowing expression.
name: A Carnatic Quartet

performer.description: Curated by violinist Shreya Devnath, this Quartet is a unique confluence of four masterful artistes and two powerful instrumental pairings—each rooted in distinct cultural traditions within the Carnatic idiom.
performer.name: A Carnatic Quartet

description:
His acclaimed discography includes Ha!, Twisted Blues, and Triple Play,
featuring a rotating lineup of all-star musicians. A celebrated live
performer, Oz has played top stages worldwide and is also a respected
educator, regularly teaching at Berklee and the Musicians Institute.
name: Oz Noy Trio Ft Dave Weckl And Brian Charette

performer.description: Oz Noy is a groundbreaking guitarist whose signature sound blends jazz, funk, rock, blues, and R&B into a bold, genre-defying style he calls “Jazz—it just doesn’t sound like it.” Born in Israel, he began performing professionally at 13 and quickly rose to become one of the country’s top session musicians. Since relocating to New York, Oz has collaborated with icons like Dave Weckl, Vinnie Colaiuta, Mike Stern, Will Lee, and Steve Lukather.
performer.name: Oz Noy Trio Ft Dave Weckl And Brian Charette

description:
Each member is an accomplished solo artist with a rich history of
international collaborations, spanning diverse musical traditions. Their
collective sound--rooted deeply in Indian classical music--is shaped by a wide
range of traditional and modern global influences, resulting in a unique and
evolving sonic identity.  
  
Mystik Vibes has performed at renowned venues, festivals, and concert halls
across India, including the Hyderabad Jazz Festival, NCPA Mumbai, Prashanti
Nilayam (Puttaparthi), Bharat Nivas (Auroville), and Chowdiah Memorial Hall
(Bangalore), among others. The band has also released two critically
appreciated albums: The Shadow Tree (2012) and Fourth Dimension (2017).
name: Mystik Vibes – Journey

performer.description: Mystik Vibes is a vibrant cross-cultural trio that reimagines Indian music in a contemporary light. Hailing from Bangalore, the ensemble brings together the nuanced artistry of Hindustani tabla and percussionist Muthu Kumar, Carnatic flautist Amith Nadig, and contemporary pianist Aman Mahajan.
performer.name: Mystik Vibes – Journey
